court: IN IN IN THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY
judgment_text:
:1:

IN IN IN THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY

IN IN IN ITS INSOLVENCY JURISDICTION ITS INSOLVENCY JURISDICTION ITS INSOLVENCY JURISDICTION

OFFICIAL OFFICIAL OFFICIAL ASSIGNEE S REPORT DATED 2ND DECEMBER, 2006 ASSIGNEE S REPORT DATED 2ND DECEMBER, 2006 ASSIGNEE S REPORT DATED 2ND DECEMBER, 2006

IN IN IN

INSOLVENCY INSOLVENCY INSOLVENCY NO. 40 OF 1966 NO. 40 OF 1966 NO. 40 OF 1966

Re: B.G. Seth.

... Insolvent.

Ex-parte :

Mr. Harjivan Devshi Chauhan. ... Petitioning Creditor.

....

Mr. Y.C. Parikh, Official Assignee present.

.....

CORAM CORAM CORAM : DR. D.Y. CHANDRACHUD,J. : DR. D.Y. CHANDRACHUD,J. : DR. D.Y. CHANDRACHUD,J.

th th th DECEMBER 2006. DECEMBER 2006. DECEMBER 2006.

P.C. P.C. P.C. : : :

.

An order of adjudication was passed on 21st June

.

The first dividend of Rs.0.32 ps.

in a rupee

was

declared

on th May and further dividend of Rs.0.12

ps.

in a rupee on rd September .

Cash balance is of

Rs.

.14

ps.

and

Rs.2000/- is

invested

in

fixed

deposit.

The aggregate amount of Rs.2885.14 ps.

is lying

in the estate as against the proved preferential liability

of Rs.1,34,444.33 ps. and unsecured liability of

Rs.29,993.85 ps. No further recoveries are possible.

.

The Official Assignee has prayed that cash balance

of

Rs.2,885.14

ps.

may be transferred to the

unclaimed

dividend

capital

account

under Rule of

the

Bombay

Insolvency

Rules, and thereafter to

the

unclaimed

dividend capital revenue account and the account may be

closed for administrative purposes.

:2:

.

Having regard to the circumstances set out in the

report

of

the Official Assignee, there is no reason

why

the

prayer

should not be granted.

Prayer clause (a)

of

the report of the Official Assignee is accordingly

granted.

-----
